intro: Taguaria vera, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Nelumbonaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid environment. It is often found growing in shallow water bodies such as lakes and wetlands. Due to its cultural and ecological significance, it is considered an important species in Andean biodiversity.
